## 판결문 요약












Opinion issued May 15, 2009 

















In The
Court of Appeals
For The
First District of Texas




NO. 01-09-00416-CR




EX PARTE DONALD W. PUGH, Applicant




Original Proceeding on Application for Writ of Habeas Corpus




MEMORANDUM OPINION
          Applicant, Donald W. Pugh, requests that this Court issue an emergency pre-trial writ of habeas corpus, conduct a hearing on it, and grant relief by admitting
applicant to a reasonable bond and releasing him from confinement.
Facts
          Applicant is under an April 2, 2009 indictment for manslaughter in the 248th
District Court of Harris County, Texas.  He asserts his poor health prevented him
from making a docket call, which caused the trial court, on May 5, 2009, without
hearing, to revoke his bond and order him taken into custody.  On May 6, 2009,
applicant filed in the trial court an application for writ of habeas corpus and motion
for reinstatement of bond.  The trial court refused hearing on applicant’s bond
revocation and application for writ of habeas corpus.  On May 8, 2009, at the trial
court’s direction, applicant was placed in the Harris County jail.  Applicant asserts
that he has been placed in the general jail population where his health is jeopardized
due to non-provision of medications and other considerations.
